Trump is trying to push people into categories that do not fit. He did it with the Muslim ban, the round ups of undocumented immigrants, and now refusing to recognize the legitimacy of transgender people. These people, including students are required to to dress and live as members of the gender they feel part of before any surgery to change their bodies. To deny them the right to use the bathroom they need to use to be follow this process is to deny their very identities. Once again, President Trump has shown his lack of understanding of basic humanity. Shame on him. His careless decision can and should be challenged in the courts. I am an older, heterosexual man, but I say to our young people: Stand with your brothers and sisters. Don't let anyone treat any of them with anything but respect, and compassion when they are oppressed. Fight for each other's rights.
May god keep and protect u and your family

The only species of mosquito that will be affected, Aedes aegypti, is not native to Florida. Due to increased globalization and a warming climate, the species has drastically increased its range and can now be found in many tropical and subtropical regions around the world, including Florida. I don't think exterminating this once adventive species of mosquito (there are about ~150 species in the U.S.) will have any substantial ecological impacts.
